name: Affinity by Maxmel Tech
title: Affinity by Maxmel Tech
description: How to integrate Affinity with Make.com

children.text: Affinity is a relationship intelligence and deal management platform for private capital firms, offering AI-driven CRM and data enrichment. Integrating with Make.com enables automated workflows, streamlined deal tracking, and enhanced data connectivity across investment and CRM tools.
This is AI-generated content based on official Affinity documentation. The content may still contain errorsâ€”please verify important information. If you have questions, contact
How to get support on Affinity

Affinity is a community-developed application and is subjected to the developer's terms and conditions, which may include applicable fees. Make does not maintain or support this integration. For assistance, please https://f.make.com/r/reachout?app_name=Affinity&app_slug=affinity-community&app_unique_id=affinity-1kv763.
To use the Affinity app in Make,
you must have an active Affinity account with a supported paid plan and the necessary permissions to generate an API key,
To install this app, you need Admin, Owner, or App Developer permissions.
the on-screen instructions to complete the setup.
To get started, you must first create a connection between Affinity and
, allowing the two services to communicate.
You can connect using the following method: API Keys,Bearer Authentication.
You need to generate your API key.
Login to your Affinity account using your credentials.
Navigate to the Settings page in the Affinity web app.
Ensure you have the Generate an API key role-based permission. If you do not, contact your Affinity admin.
Locate the section to generate an API key.
Note and securely store your API key.
You need to generate your API key.
Login to your platform using your credentials.
Navigate to the Settings page in the Affinity web app.
Ensure you have the Generate an API key role-based permission. If you do not have this permission, contact your Affinity admin.
Locate the option to generate an API key.
Note and securely store the generated API key.

from the community developer's dashboard, generally found under

If you add a module with an instant tag, click
field, enter a name for the connection.
you copied from your Affinity or follow the on-screen instructions to create the connection. You must also enter any required third-party API keys obtained earlier.
For detailed information on connecting an application, see
After connecting to the Affinity app, you can choose from a list of available modules to build your
Creates a brand new note, allowing you to quickly capture and save your ideas or information.
Adds a new person to your database, allowing you to store and manage their details for future reference.
Creates a brand new sales opportunity, allowing you to track and manage potential deals from the very beginning.
Creates a brand new organization in your account, allowing you to manage teams, projects, or resources under this new organizational structure.
Permanently removes a specific note from your account using its unique ID.
Permanently removes a specific person from your records using their unique ID.
Permanently removes a specific opportunity from your account using its unique ID.
Retrieves all lists associated with a specific company, allowing you to view and manage the lists linked to that company.
Retrieves a list of all entries associated with a specific company, allowing you to view and manage detailed information for that company.
Fetches detailed information about every list in your account, including their names, IDs, and other key properties.
Fetches detailed information about a specific company using the provided company ID.
Retrieves detailed information about a specific list using its unique ID.
Retrieves detailed information about a specific person using their unique ID.
Retrieves all the lists associated with a specific person ID, allowing you to see which lists that person belongs to.
Retrieves detailed information about a specific opportunity.
Fetches the values of custom fields for a specific entity based on its ID, allowing you to access detailed, tailored information associated with that particular record.
Fetches and displays a list of all available opportunities, allowing you to view and manage them easily.
Allows you to make custom, authorized API requests to the connected service, enabling you to access features or data not covered by the standard modules.
Retrieves a list of companies that match the criteria you specify, making it easy to find exactly the businesses you're looking for.
Finds and retrieves list entries that match the criteria you set, helping you quickly locate the specific items you need.
Search List Entries from a Saved View
Finds and retrieves list entries that match your chosen criteria from a saved view, helping you quickly locate the specific information you need.
Finds and retrieves information about organizations based on your search criteria.
Retrieves a list of people who match the criteria you specify, helping you quickly find the individuals youâ€™re looking for.
Updates the value of a custom field for a specific entity you choose, allowing you to tailor information to your needs.
Updates the value of a specific custom field, allowing you to modify and keep your data up to date according to your needs.
Updates the details of an existing person using their unique ID, allowing you to modify information such as name, contact details, or other personal data.
Updates the details of an existing opportunity, allowing you to modify information such as status, value, or other relevant fields.
Updates the details of an existing organization, allowing you to modify information such as the organization's name, contact details, or other relevant settings.
Triggers when a particular event youâ€™ve chosen takes place, allowing you to automatically start your scenario based on that specific activity.

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
